Detailed Description

Quantizes image into K levels, then does multiscale segmentation Does not implement the pruning techniques discussed in the paper.

See: V. Lakshmanan, R. Rabin, and V. DeBrunner, ``Multiscale storm identification and forecast,'' J. Atm. Res., vol. 67, pp. 367-380, July 2003

Author:
v.lakshmanan

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

int  thresh2,
int  K

Specify contouring levels. 

00037                                                                       {
00038         this.THRESH1 = thresh1;
00039         this.THRESH2 = thresh2;
00040         this.K = K;
00041         this.INCR = (double)(THRESH2 - THRESH1) / K;
00042     }

LatLonGrid edu.ou.asgbook.segmentation.MultiscaleKMeansSegmenter.quantize ( LatLonGrid  data,
File  out 
)

Contours grid into levels 1,2,3.

..K 

00123                                                          {
00124         final int nrows = data.getNumLat();
00125         final int ncols = data.getNumLon();
00126         
00127         // initialize based on simple quantization
00128         LatLonGrid seed = LatLonGrid.copyOf(data);
00129         for (int i=0; i < nrows; ++i) for (int j=0; j < ncols; ++j){
00130             int levelno = 0;
00131             if (data.getValue(i, j) != data.getMissing()){
00132                 levelno = (int) Math.round((data.getValue(i,j) - THRESH1)/INCR);
00133                 if ( levelno < 0 ) levelno = 0;
00134                 else if ( levelno > K ) levelno = K;
00135             }
00136             seed.setValue(i,j, levelno);
00137         }
00138         if (out != null){
00139             try {
00140                 KmlWriter.write(seed, out, "levels_0", PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00141             } catch (Exception e) {
00142                 System.err.println(e);
00143             }
00144         }
00145         
00146         // Start K-means
00147         int iter = 1;
00148         int n_changed = 0;
00149         do {
00150             // compute means: could get away with simply using center of data range ...
00151             Cluster[] clusters = findClusters(data, seed, K);
00152             // move pixels
00153             LatLonGrid next = LatLonGrid.copyOf(seed);
00154             n_changed = 0;
00155             for (int i=0; i < nrows; ++i) for (int j=0; j < ncols; ++j){
00156                 if ( data.getValue(i,j) != data.getMissing() ){
00157                     int closest = findClosestCluster(data.getValue(i,j),i,j,seed, clusters);
00158                     if (closest != seed.getValue(i,j)){
00159                         // change the label to closest
00160                         next.setValue(i, j, closest);
00161                         ++n_changed;
00162                     }
00163                 }
00164             }
00165             System.out.println("Changing " + n_changed + " at " + iter + " th iteration");
00166             // for next step
00167             seed = next;
00168             
00169             if (out != null){
00170                 try {
00171                     KmlWriter.write(seed, out, "levels_" + iter, PngWriter.createCoolToWarmColormap());
00172                 } catch (Exception e) {
00173                     System.err.println(e);
00174                 }
00175             }
00176             
00177             ++iter;
00178         } while (iter < MAX_ITER && n_changed > 0);
00179         return seed;
00180     }
